ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, A very profound view into Clarin's works
A deep analysis of Leopoldo Alas' work. I would definitely recommend it to another student because it is engaging.

I would recommend this course to any fellow student with no reservation. Even if the subject author is not of their taste, anyone interested in literary criticism shall be glad to receive lessons from professor Valis.
I would strongly recommend it for a student interested in a monographic course on perhaps the most important 19th-century Spanish author of realism-naturalism-literary criticism.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Helped see literary realism differently, not as petrified as it is usually seen
It made me be interested in a field I thought I was not attracted at first. I was very positively surprised.

Even though my own interests are not altogether directly connected to the course subject, n a general sense, this course has been extremely helpful to both my knowledge of my profession and my dissertation, as long as it is an excellent example of critical approach to an author and his literary period, and therefore extensible to many others.
It will be very useful for my research.
